reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Moving graphic novel
reviews.reviewText: Read this in hour and nearly cried at the end. Deeply poignant, but also uplifting and heartfelt . Mr. Jarrett is a incredibly skilled author and illustrator.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I am not a real big reader of graphic novels. However, as part of my classroom challenge with my students I had to read a graphic novel. I chose this one because I had read his former book, "Hey Kiddo". I enjoyed this book even more and can't wait for my students to read it. This is the author's true story of a year in high school when he worked at a summer camp for students who had cancer. The way he was able to inspire those he worked with was amazing. What was more amazing was the way these kids inspired and changed his life. It is not an easy book to read due to the topic. I found myself moved to tears throughout the book. The author doesn't sugar coat things, not even his own tough life. He was raised by his grandparents. The reasons can be found by reading this book. I highly recommend it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heartwarming and heartbreaking all at once!
reviews.reviewText: Jarrett Krosoczka has mastered the art of graphic novel memoir and I highly recommend both of his books in this category. Sunshine was a great follow-up to Hey Kiddo, picking up during Jarrett's senior year of high school when he spent a week volunteering at a camp for kids with severe illnesses. It is abundantly clear how much this experience changed Jarrett's outlook on life, and I absolutely love that he tells us the student volunteers were chosen by lottery and he was one of the lucky few. It was truly meant to be. And now readers everywhere will get to know the children that changed Jarrett's life through this graphic novel. It's heartwarming and heartbreaking all at once. Just like life.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A teen counselor at a camp for gravely ill youths
reviews.reviewText: This book is an offhoot story from the same author/artist's memoir -- Hey, Kiddo. With the newer title sharing the same comic book/graphic novel style as the prior memoir, this was again a fast read for me. Here Jarrett, in high school, volunteered to be a counselor at a camp for youths limited by cancer and similar illnesses. The camp acted as a respite not only for these kids and teens, but for their families as well.Jarrett's adoptive grandma appeared early in the story and, to my relief, came across much less abrasive than in Hey, Kiddo. Nonetheless, she revealed her own assumptions that the camp would end up a depressing setting for her grandson.While there was some sadness, the story also recounted how the camp kids (and volunteers) established camaraderie and risked leaving their comfort zones. One standout character made obvious his fandom of the 1990s Power Rangers. I was also impressed to see one participant family at the camp code-switching in Spanish/English.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This Book shows how powerful it is to help others
reviews.reviewText: This book tells the story about how a teenager got involved with a cancer camp. It shows how lifechanging the experience can be for the campers and also the staff.The book really spoke to me as a Camp Director. I can really relate to this book and its message. At camp you really do have a powerful opportunity to bring joy to those who may otherwise not find it, and the bonds you create at camp are very very special.I would say that its audience would be for families who are thinking about whether or not to take an opportunity to be more involved in a community. It could also be for anyone who is serving a community since it speaks to how great helping others can help yourself.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Brought back wonderful memories
reviews.reviewText: Thank you Jarrett for writing this book, I got it and read it from beginning to end. I remember all those feelings from getting chosen to go , to going with a group that were not necessarily in my friend group, experiencing all that Camp sunshine had to offer, the amazing families I met along the way, the ups the downs. I went there for 16 years. Spent weeks of my summer volunteering and spending my weekends with “papa” and his wife. I knew who “Joy” was right away, she was an amazing person and volunteer and had so much love to give. Thank you for allowing me to reminisce, laugh and cry. What a wonderful tribute to an amazing place and sharing the inspirational bond you created with your family for so many years. That’s what makes this book so special.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This was an amazing graphic novel for mature middle schoolers and for young adults.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2023

reviews.reviewerName: Luis in Mexico City, Amazon CustomerLuis in Mexico City, Amazon Customer
reviews.reviewTitle: Novela gráfica en inglés acerca de una semana que cambió la vida del autor
reviews.reviewText: Novela gráfica de hechos reales, entretenida y de buen contenido. En Estados Unidos, en los años 90, un joven participa en un campamento de una semana para niños con cáncer o problemas de salud, al cual también van sus familias. Pero no es una historia dibujada o escrita para dar lástima. Al contrario, muestra divertidas aventuras, con bromas y también con realismo. Y hace pensar. Es una estupenda lectura para jóvenes que van a ir o a organizar un campamento, o para jóvenes con alguna enfermedad y sus familiares que se identificarán con los personajes.
